data.title: Rolo Tomassi - Grievances
data.meta_description:
Rolo Tomassi, the female-fronted British band NME dubbed mathcore noise bastards (and bastress), release their North American debut album, Grievances, on July 10 via Ipecac Recordings.

The band, which hails from Sheffield, formed in 2005, taking their name from the film L.A. Confidential. While Rolo Tomassi have yet to release an album Stateside, the band has toured the U.S. with Janes Addiction, joined Dillinger Escape Plan on their European outing and saw their 2010 album, Cosmology, produced by Diplo. Pitchfork said singer Eva Spence is, equally comfortable singing in a glassy, ethereal coo and a glasses-shattering screech.
